rev.comment: Add references section and/or general fixes.
/* John Lennon */ converted citations to sfn
/* John Lennon */ converted citations to sfn
/* John Lennon */ converted citations to sfn
/* Writing and poetry */ converted citations to sfn
/* Electronic music */ converted citations to sfn
/* Jane Asher */ converted citations to sfn
/* Dot Rhone */ converted citations to sfn

/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ converted citations to sfn

Reverted to revision 349115790 by [[Special:Contributions/GabeMc|GabeMc]]; Rv removal of alt text. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ added work=
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ corrected citation name
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
/* Childhood */ excessive comma usage/no need for commas after every date/some copy editing
/* Football */ changed some publisher= to work=, citation fix, internal consistancy.
/* Football */ fixed some citations, language, and a misquote,
/* George Harrison */ fixed citation/covered bare url
/* George Harrison */ citation fix, changed some "publishers" to "works"

/* Since 1970 */ removed "In May 2009, it was announced McCartney and [[Bob Dylan]] will collaborate with [[Ringo Starr]] to record a few songs for release in 2010." three dead citations didn't happen
Fix some publisher= that should be work=
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ citation fix
/* George Harrison */ moved citation to it's proper place, expanded quote, covered bare url.
/* George Harrison */ moved citation to it's proper place.
moved sentence to last lead paragraph
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ changed 31 to 32, added citation for Elton John hit with McCartneys name on it.
changed 31 to 32, HotCop2 pointed out that "Lucy" was a Hot 100 #1 for Elton John with Lennon on guitar and background vocals
fixed internal inconsistancy with cited sources
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ page said 3,500, source cited, an online poll, said 2,200. Made page agree with source.
removed: Following the death of his first wife Linda in 1998, McCartney married [[Heather Mills]] in 2002. They divorced in 2008. McCartney is now partners with Nancy Shevell. This is covered below,
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ deleted improper comma
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ fixed citation
Removed sentence "(credited to Lennon/McCartney, as all songs written by either Lennon or McCartney during their partnership as Beatles were, but composed entirely by McCartney.) Common Knowledge
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ erased period
this link: http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/news/2008/09/080916.aspx, does not verify any sales data, we need someone with a copy to cite the source properly.
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ we need an actual citation for this sales claim, does anyone have a copy of the book in front of them?
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ added his UK hit with "The Christians et all" as per the original; source UK top 40 at everyhit.com
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ corrected his UK singles info, Paul had 24 UK hits, not 23 as listed previously as per the cited source.
the only valid source for this claim is Guinness.
removed three redundant and invalid ciations to a David Letterman show appearence.
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ redirected citation
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ removed invalid source
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ Removed double citation to the same invalid source, the 23 minute Denver interview that confirms nothing of substance.
that 7,000,000 American plays has only one citation, a blurb on the BBC news site with no verification, is this a valid source?
You appear to be the only one objecting to the current text. Please discuss first.
Undid revision 347773201 by [[Special:Contributions/John Cardinal|John Cardinal]] ([[User talk:John Cardinal|talk]]) You are taking ownership over this page in violation of WP policies
Revert to revision 347663740 dated 2010-03-04 06:32:31 by John Cardinal using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Removed sentence "(credited to Lennon/McCartney, as all songs written by either Lennon or McCartney during their partnership as Beatles were, but composed entirely by McCartney.) Common Knowledge
Undid revision 347772453 by [[Special:Contributions/Pawnkingthree|Pawnkingthree]] ([[User talk:Pawnkingthree|talk]]) The previous was self researched.
The previous version was quite clear and sourced - 31 no.1s as a songwriter and performer.
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ changed 31 to 30, and 21 to 20, since Macca is not a co-credit on Harrison's "For You Blue", and as such had 20 Lennon/MCartney Hot 100 #1s, not 21.
changerd 31 back to 30, John, are you really saying Macca was "responsible" for the Harrison tune "For You Blue"?
Undid revision 347657263 by [[Special:Contributions/GabeMc|GabeMc]] ([[User talk:GabeMc|talk]]) Correct second instance of error
Undid revision 347661017 by [[Special:Contributions/GabeMc|GabeMc]] ([[User talk:GabeMc|talk]]) 31 - Add song he wrote for another artist
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ changed 31 to 30, like I said, Paul had 9 solo #1 hits on the Hot 100, the Beatles had 21, that makes 30.
changed 31 U.S. hits to 30, "Let Em In" was not a Billboard Hot 100 #1, it peaked at #3. Paul had 9 solo American #1s and 21 with the Beatles.
rm citation needed (details below), changed count to 31 as supported by Billboard sources listed below, one link for Billboard Hot 100
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ update counts based on review of Billboard sources, slight rearrangement of copy
/* Critique, recognition and achievements */ invalid source, added citation needed request, I left the old invalid source so you can waste 23 mintues yourself if you want to.
Undid revision 347603142 by [[Special:Contributions/GabeMc|GabeMc]] ([[User talk:GabeMc|talk]]) Details cited in achievements section

Removed McCartney practices meditation, using the mantra that the Maharishi Mahesh Yogi gave him. I read in an interview that the only time he practised was while detained in Japan for drug possession
/* John Lennon */ changed Yoko to Ono
/* John Lennon */ added linda's comments on John and Paul.
/* John Lennon */ added Paul's comments on his last phone conversation with John.
/* John Lennon */ moved section for coherence
{{pp-semi-blp}} categorizes this under Category:Wikipedia temporarily semi-protected biographies of living people given expiration
Undid revision 346500696 by [[Special:Contributions/AnomieBOT|AnomieBOT]] ([[User talk:AnomieBOT|talk]]) Bot removed reference; not clear why
/* George Harrison */ Changed reference - see [[WP:ELNEVER]], fixed typos
/* George Harrison */ Added some balance with quotes from George and John, their relationship was mixed.
added category ; for an award he won
[[Help:Reverting|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/GabeMc|GabeMc]] ([[User talk:GabeMc|talk]]) to last version by John Cardinal
Revert to revision 345129510 dated 2010-02-20 01:06:46 by Discographer using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
Removed subjects covered below at length
Removed record and film producer, many artist have produced their own music at times, does this make them all producers? Film producer? JUst cause he made one cartoon dodes not make him a producer.
I swapped musician for multi-instrumentalist, which I think is officially is reserved for people who are accomplished on multiple instuments not just capable.
Paul has been an animal rights activist, but he was never a peace activist, unless I missed the entire 1960s and 70s.
opening section was top heavy, deleted text was all information already contained in the ==Critique, recognition and achievements== section.
/* 1957–1960 */ added Johnny and the Moondogs and the Nerk Twins as two other pre-May 1960 group names.
link town name in pic; UK dates: rm sovereign state
Robot - Removing category People associated with the hippie movement per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2010 January 27]].
Added a new photo in the infobox and moved the last one down in the article
/* Relationships and marriages */ Reworded section heading to match corresponding article title
Added the coat of arms granted to Sir Paul in 2001
Wings template added to the Paul McCartney related articles
